**Regional Handicap and Wheelchair Lift Repair/Services Tender Announcement**
===============================================

**Reference Number**:     cb-450-27565292

**Tender Closing Date**:   January 19, 2024, 13:00:00

**Notice Type**: Request for Standing Offer

**Procurement Category**: Service

**Bidding Information**
----------------------

This is a request for standing offer (SOA) for the repair and maintenance of handicap and wheelchair lifts in the Atlantic Region. The government seeks interested suppliers to submit a bid.

**Description of Work**
----------------------

The work entails providing specialized labor, materials, tools, and equipment to perform minor repairs and maintenance, as well as replacement of handicap and wheelchair lifts. The contractor will be required to work at various locations in New Brunswick and Nova Scotia.

**Documents**
------------

* The solicitation document and associated documents can be downloaded from the Canada Buys/Tender Opportunities website.
* Bidders can request a debriefing on the results of the bid solicitation process within 15 working days of receipt of the results.

**Contact Information**
---------------------

Penny Panayiotopoullos, Contracting Authority
Phone: (506) 875-3649
Email: [penny.panayiotopoullos@csc-scc.gc.ca](mailto:penny.panayiotopoullos@csc-scc.gc.ca)

**Additional Information**
------------------------

* The estimated quantity of commodity can be found in the solicitation document statement of work and basis of payment.
* The duration of the standing offer is from the contract award date to March 31, 2025, with the option to renew for two additional one-year periods.
* This procurement is not subject to any set-asides for Indigenous Suppliers.

**Procurement Assistance Canada (PAC)**
-------------------------------------

PAC offers seminars to businesses interested in learning how to sell goods and services to the Government of Canada. The seminars are FREE and cover topics such as:

* Overview of the federal government contracting process
* Searching for opportunities on the Buy and Sell - Tenders website
* Bidding on opportunities
* Registering in supplier databases

The full schedule of seminars can be found on the Buyandsell.gc.ca website, under Event Calendar.
